abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column examines success of 19-year-old Nick Kyrgios, who will face Andy Murray in Australian Open quarterfinals; notes that Kyrgios, whose brilliant play is sometimes spiked with salty outbursts, has generated significant excitement in his home country.
lead_paragraph: Nick Kyrgios, a 19-year-old Australian in the quarterfinals of the Australian Open, offers a spirited and often salty approach to the game.
snippet: Nick Kyrgios, a 19-year-old Australian in the quarterfinals of the Australian Open, offers a spirited and often salty approach to the game.

headline.main: A Temper, and a Shot, to Make McEnroe Proud
headline.seo: Nick Kyrgios Is Nicknamed the Wild Thing, With Good Reason
headline.print_headline: A Temper, and a Shot, to Make McEnroe Proud
